notesStmt.note: Usage stains. Pigment loss in ink at first coloured initial word. Large strips of leather lost on board leather. Also thickness losses at edges & corners of the board.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p:
30 quires: i-xxix10 (folios 1-290), xxx6-1 (folios 291-295).
Catchwords and signatures in Hebrew characters at the end of quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the first half of the 15th century. Yeḥiel ben Yo᾿av of Bet El: inscribed with his name in the colophon, Rome, undated (folios 295r).

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r3 decorated initial-word panels accompanied by foliate scrolls in the margins, in colours and gold.
4v3 decorated initial-word panels accompanied by foliate scrolls in the margins, in colours and gold.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather. Spine: 'Ibn Sina. Kanun. Hebrew. Vol. I and II. Brit. Mus. Additional 21,967.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Rev. A. Löwy: purchased by the British Museum from him on 25 April 1857: inscribed (f. [296v]).
